fr.sorbonne_u.components.ports

Interface InboundPortI

  • All Superinterfaces:
    ComponentServiceI, OfferedI, PortI, java.rmi.Remote
    All Known Subinterfaces:
    DataInboundPortI, TwoWayPortI<TWI>
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    AbstractDataInboundPort, AbstractDataInboundPortForPlugin, AbstractDataTwoWayPort, AbstractDataTwoWayPortForPlugin, AbstractInboundPort, AbstractInboundPortForPlugin, AbstractTwoWayPort, AbstractTwoWayPortForPlugin, DynamicComponentCreationInboundPort, DynamicConnectionRequestInboundPort, ExampleInboundPort, IntegerFilteringInboundPort, IntegerProcessingInboundPort, IntercessionInboundPort, IntrospectionInboundPort, MapReadingInboundPort, MapWritingInboundPort, MyServiceInboundPort, PairDataInboundPort, PingPongDataInboundPort, PingPongDataTwoWayPort, PingPongInboundPort, PingPongTwoWayPort, PushControlInboundPort, ReflectionInboundPort, URIConsumerLaunchInboundPort, URIProviderInboundPort, URIProviderInboundPort, ValueProvidingInboundPort

    public interface InboundPortI
extends PortI, OfferedI
    The interface InboundPortI represents the category of PortI that cater for incoming calls from client components towards the service providers.

    Description

    An inbound port is a component port through which a provider component is called to deliver its services. It is therefore associated with an offered interface that represents the services that are provided by the component but that it also implements so that its owner component is called only through the inbound ports.

    Invariant

     invariant              OfferedI.class.isAssignableFrom(p.getImplementedInterface())
 invariant              this.getOwner().isOfferedInterface(this.getImplementedInterface())
 invariant              this.connected() implies
                  this.getPortURI().equals(this.getServerPortURI())

    Created on : 2011-11-07

    Author:
    Jacques Malenfant
